page.title: 04CHURCH OF ALL SAINTS, CADEBY
page.content:
Social life in Cadeby, like that of most small rural communities, is centred around the church. The 13th century Church of All Saints provides for the usual spiritual needs of the area and can generally expect a congregation of 70-80 worshippers for the more important religious festivals. The church holds two whist drives per month, a garden party in August and a fireworks party in November, with all proceeds helping towards the upkeep of the buildings and a contribution to the Parish Share.
The Church Hall is the only meeting place in the village and is therefore the venue for all indoor events. Market Bosworth Rotary Club meet here every Tuesday and the Cadeby Flower Club uses the hall once a month.
